subject: Travel
title: Gift-Giving in China
description: A quick win: understand Gift-Giving in China.

hook.text: In China, receiving a gift with one hand is disrespectful. You must always use both hands.

buildup.text: Gifts are never opened in front of the giver. Opening them immediately looks greedy.

discovery.text: Never give a clock as a gift. The phrase 'giving a clock' sounds identical to 'attending a funeral.'

twist.text: Red envelopes with money are the most common gift. But the amount must never include the number four.

climax.text: The number four sounds like 'death' in Mandarin. Even buildings skip the fourth floor.

punchline.text: In China, a wrong number on a gift can ruin a friendship.

quiz.question: Why should you never give a clock as a gift in China?
options: 'Giving a clock' sounds like 'attending a funeral'
Time gifts are only for elders
